lexUnit.name: corridor.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: long passage from which doors lead into rooms.

sentence.text: He picked himself up and staggered down a corridor .
He tried to read every scrap of newspaper in the school ; even the loose pieces blowing through the corridors and those stuffed underneath mattresses .
The fire Research Station 's fire Detection Department built a full sized hotel corridor and , for the first time , has monitored what happens in the early stages of a typical hotel fire .
McCready had watched him enter the corridor between the two border posts , then lost sight of him .
Make a secret WP test for each character entering this corridor .
He was just about to enter the corridor on what was then the quicker route to the kitchen , when he overhead a sob and a plaintive , ` My husband suspects , Nicolai .
They both entered a corridor at the same time , she going one way , he the other .
He left the corridor and went through the newsroom to the features department next door .
At first it was just the bodies that had been left in the corridors .
Each was a hi-tech header from Nigel Mottashed , moving through the central corridor .
He moved down the corridor and around the corner , where two more armed guards stood , alert , against either wall .
So far , though , the Americans have not yet moved from the corridors to the negotiating table itself .
They moved out slowly into the corridor , Chen looking about him , prepared at any moment to thrust the knife deep into Herrick 's throat .
He moved down the corridor nearer to the window to get better reception .
He ran down the corridor to fetch his own letter home and gave it to Murray , taking this small offer of service as a token that their friendship would continue .
She ran back into the corridor and back towards the service lift .
Ranetta Sen , 13 , was running along a corridor to her next class when she crashed into a wall and fell to the floor .
The guard was running in the corridor .
With passions running high and reporters running down corridors in search of statements , the sequence of events and their meaning became confused .
Someone ran up the corridor behind them .
He had run down the long corridors to the lounge and arrived just as the shuttle passengers were disembarking .
I ran into the corridor , and just then I heard a whistle , and a minute later the sound of falling metal .
She ran down the corridor .
I stamped up the stairs , ran along the corridor , slammed my door and then jumped on my bed .
" Of course , " he said , " of Course , " and he even showed her the corridor that led to the Ladies ' room , and she escaped , and they escaped from each other .
For a while he sat in a corridor outside the room where the medical team was saving Edmund Jason 's life , and he did his bit by praying hard but silently for the young man .
Simon was sitting in the corridor outside the door to Jason 's room , heartily asleep in an uncomfortable upright chair .
` Then you must sleep out in the corridor . "
And , with a horrified shudder , it occurred to Folly that if she stayed any longer in the corridor she might hear more than talking in the room beyond the door .
Taking his visitor by the arm , he walked her slowly along the corridor .
As he pushes through the swing doors and walks down the corridor towards his office , he can hear them spluttering with stifled laughter .
Alice Conway turned about and walked down the corridor , her hands spread out as if in appeal , her head bobbing as she said , ` What 's come over people ?
Trench came up to me as I turned to walk down the corridor again .
He laughed with forced heartiness , as limping badly he began to walk along the corridor , leading the way , and Hari realized that he had used the laugh many times to conceal his true feelings .
He walked out of the tiny corridor , through the foyer and out to his car .
She put the key in her pocket and walked into the corridor .
Then he and Billie climbed to the next floor and walked down the corridor to Room 416 .
There was something about the atmosphere of a theatre that never failed to stir her blood , Shannon mused as she walked along the corridors .
They walked down the corridor in single file , Shiona leading the way to her front door .
The side corridor ran along the length of these three rooms , and opened at the other end of the car into a comfortable lounge , with settee , three armchairs , and tables .
Smaller corridors ran to the left and right , curving away from the junction alongside the wall .
He would stand in the corridor which ran along past the junior classrooms , as he had done that morning , and listen to the lessons being given .
